epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
product_description.product_use: General purpose concrete for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_description.special_class_concrete_use: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transportation; manufacturing of concrete; treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete (Module D)

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump; manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime
carbonation.note: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Processed waste concrete used as recycled aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate

concrete_classes.normal_class: Everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
concrete_classes.special_class: High strength, durability, marine, post-tensioned, high pumpability, architectural finishes, decorative

references: Australasian EPD Programme Guidance and Instructions (2017-2024)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
